children.name: have a sweet taste b1
children.definition: have a sweet/strong/bitter etc taste
examples: the soup had a very strong, spicy taste.

children.name: taste b1
children.definition: tasteto have a particular kind of taste
examples: taste of sth
this yoghurt tastes of strawberries.
it didn’t taste much of ginger.
taste like sth
it tastes just like champagne to me.
what does pumpkin taste like(= how would you describe its taste )?
taste good/nice/delicious/greatthe apples weren’t very big but they tasted good.
taste horrible/awful/disgusting/foulthe tea tasted horrible.
taste funny/odd/strangethese fruit drinks taste a bit funny until you get used to them.
taste sweet/bitter/sour/saltyhe handed me some black stuff which tasted bitter.
taste strongly of somethingthe water tasted strongly of chlorine.
sweet-tasting/strong-tasting etca sweet-tasting drink

children.name: flavored x
children.definition: flavoureduk/flavoredus
examples: 1 strawberry-flavoured/chocolate-flavoured etctasting of strawberries , chocolate etc
an orange-flavoured drink
orange-flavoured chocolate mint-flavoured sweets
2having had a flavour added :
flavored coffees
we have a variety of flavored waters available.
the potato salad was flavored with onions, the way mattie liked it.
highly flavoured/ strongly flavoured etc
the wines of alsace are dry and delicately flavoured.

children.name: hot b1
children.definition: hot food that has a hot taste seems to burn your mouth, and makes you want to drink a lot of water:cay nồng
examples: the curry was so hot i couldn’t finish it.
the sauce had a hot, peppery taste.

children.name: spicy b1
children.definition: spicy spicy food tastes pleasantly hot and often seems to have a mix of different tastes: dậy mùi, có gia vị
examples: tina loves hot spicy food.
i added ginger and cumin to give the rice a spicy flavour.

children.name: fiery x
children.definition: fiery food or drink that is fiery has an extremely hot taste that burns your throat: cay nồng, “nảy lửa”
examples: peter always makes really fiery chilli con carne.
discard all the chilli seeds, unless you want an extremely fiery soup.

children.name: peppery x
children.definition: pepperypeppery having a spicy flavour like pepper:
examples: this salad has a sharp peppery flavour.

children.name: bland c2
children.definition: bland disapproving food or drink that is bland has very little taste and is not interesting to eat or drink:nhạt nhẽo
examples: if the sauce is bland, add a little more vinegar.
at first, give the baby tiny portions of any bland food that has been sieved or pureed.
i find chicken a little bland.

children.name: tasteless c1
children.definition: tasteless food that is tasteless has little or no taste and is rather unpleasant:vô vị nhạt nhẽo
examples: why is airplane food always so tasteless?
a plate of tasteless, overcooked vegetables

children.name: have no taste b1
children.definition: have no taste/ not have any taste to have very little taste - use this especially when you think somethingshould have more taste: không có vị, nhạt nhẽo
examples: the most disappointing dish was the chicken-filled tortellini with a pesto sauce that had almost no taste.
you need to add salt or something - this doesn’t have any taste at all.

children.name: not taste like anything b1
children.definition: not taste of anythinguk informal /not taste like anythingus informal  to have no particular taste:
examples: i’m not sure what kind of soup this is supposed to be. it doesn’t taste of anything to me.
the dessert wasn’t awful, but it didn’t taste like anything.

children.name: like dishwater x
children.definition: like dishwaterinformal disapproving describes a drink or liquid which is unpleasant because it is watery and has very little flavour : như nước rửa bát
examples: this soup/ teatasteslike dishwater.

children.name: watery x
children.definition: watery disapproving (of food or drink) containing too much water and therefore weak in taste: nhạt như nước lã
examples: watery soup/coffee

children.name: weak b2
children.definition: weak(of a drink) that contains a lot of water compared to its other contents, so that it does not have a strong flavour :loãng,nhạtnhẽo
examples: i can't stand weak coffee/ tea.

children.name: strong a2
children.definition: strong food or drinks that are strong have a very noticeable and particular taste:
examples: ‘how do you like your tea?’ ‘strong please, with no sugar.’
i left the restaurant with rather a strong taste of onions in my mouth.
stilton is a very strong english cheese, which has blue-green veins running through it.

children.name: rich b2
children.definition: rich food that is rich contains a lot of cheese, cream, butter, or chocolate, and makes you feel full very quickly:
examples: you mustn’t eat too much rich food -- it’s bad for you.
the meat was browned to perfection and topped with a rich sauce.

children.name: full-flavoured x
children.definition: full-flavoureduk/full-flavoredus  sth such as cheese or coffee that is full- flavoured has astrongpleasanttaste:
examples: this coffee is strong and full-flavoured, excellent for after dinner.

children.name: full-bodied x
children.definition: full-bodied a full-bodiedwinehas astrongpleasanttaste:đậm
examples: the beautiful color and full-bodied taste of these australian wines make them an excellent accompaniment to meat dishes.

children.name: sugary x
children.definition: sugary very sweet or too sweet because a lot of sugar has been added:ngọt
examples: eat fruit between meals, and try to avoid sugary snacks.

children.name: sweet a1
children.definition: sweet food or drink that is sweet has a taste like sugar:ngọt
examples: italian oranges are much sweeter than the ones we buy in britain.
a cup of hot sweet tea
the pineapple was sweet and juicy.
do you want your pancakes sweet or savoury?

children.name: sickly x
children.definition: sickly uk tasting unpleasantly sweet: ngọt nợ
examples: the melons were overripe and had a sickly taste.

children.name: smooth x
children.definition: smoothhaving a pleasant flavourwhich is not sour or bitter : dịu
examples: this coffee is incredibly smooth and rich.
smoothness[ u ]
the wine possesses a smoothness and balanced depth which is rare at such a low price.
i just love the smoothness of silk.

children.name: delicate b2
children.definition: delicate a delicate taste or flavour ispleasantand not very strong: thanh cảnh, dễ chịu
examples: the fish was served with a delicate mushroom sauce.
salmon has quite a delicate flavour, and it should not be over-cooked.
delicately[adv]
the vegetables had been cooked in a delicately flavoured marinade.

children.name: mild b2
children.definition: mild sth such as cheese or coffee that is mild has a pleasant taste but is not hot or strong: dịu nhẹ
examples: it’s a smooth, mild coffee, excellent for finishing off a meal.
a mild cigar
a mild english cheese

children.name: sour b1
children.definition: sour food that is sour, especially fruit, has a taste that stings your tongue slightly, like a lemon does:chua
examples: the strawberries are a little sour - you may need to put sugar on them.
kvass is a mild beer that is sometimes used in russian cooking for its sour flavor.

children.name: tart x
children.definition: tart fruits that are tart, especially apples, sting your tongue and make water come into your mouth: chua chát
examples: this tart citrus dressing is great on salads.
red currants are quite tart and usually need sugar or honey.

children.name: sharp x
children.definition: sharp having a strong but pleasant taste that stings your tongue: hăng
examples: the drink had a very sharp lemony taste.
i like this marmalade. it’s very sharp.
the lemon juice gives the dressing its sharp flavour.
lemons have a sharptaste.
this cheese is rather sharp.

children.name: tangy x
children.definition: tangy having a fresh, pleasant taste that stings your tongue slightly:
examples: the orange juice had a delicious tangy taste.
we made a tangy mayonnaise from yoghurt and honey.
tang[cs] the pleasantly sharp taste that some kinds of food or drink have:
the lime juice will give your sauce a delicious tang.
a unique cheese, smooth but leaving a salty tang behind on the tongue

children.name: with a taste that is not sweet
bitter b1
children.definition: bitter bitter foods, such as coffee without sugar or very dark chocolate, have a strong, sometimes unpleasant taste:đắng
examples: try not to burn the oil, it will make the sauce taste bitter.
strong, bitter coffee
the herb rue has a bitter taste, which makes it unpopular for cooking.
a bitter flavour/taste/liquid

children.name: savoury x
children.definition: savoury especially uk savoury foods are not sweet but have the taste of meat, cheese, fish etc:
examples: you can use this herb to flavour almost any savoury dish.
as a child i didn’t like sweets, but i loved crisps, nuts, and anything savoury.

children.name: dry c1
children.definition: dry a drywineis not sweet at all:nhạt
examples: we drank a dry white wine with our fish.
dry sherry

children.name: salty b2
children.definition: salty salty foods taste of salt and are not sweet at all:
examples: the french fries were too salty for me.
this wine would be excellent with a salty dish such as ham.
